title: Jaime Herrera Beutler Takes Center Stage at Impeachment Trial
summary: The GOP lawmaker's statement about a pivotal Jan. 6 call briefly delayed proceedings and focused attention on Trump's actions during the riot. WASHINGTON-Rep. Jaime Herrera Beutler unexpectedly took center stage Saturday in the impeachment trial of former President Donald Trump, after weeks in which the Republican from Washington state had been persistently pushing back against Mr. Trump and his wing of the GOP.

title: Winter Weather Warnings Issued Across the U.S.
summary: Portland and Seattle are blanketed with snow, as hundreds of thousands are left without power. Snow, ice and dangerously cold winds buffeted Americans from coast to coast over the beginning of the long weekend.

title: Supreme Court Clears Way for Extradition of Two Americans Accused in Ghosn Escape
summary: Decision brings an end to a nine-month legal effort by a father and his son to avoid being sent to Japan to face criminal charges. The extradition of two Americans accused of helping smuggle former auto titan Carlos Ghosn out of Japan appears imminent, after the U.S. Supreme Court on Saturday rejected the pair's last-ditch legal appeal.

title: Boeing CEO Said Board Moved Quickly on MAX Safety; New Details Suggest Otherwise
summary: Shareholders' suit citing internal Boeing documents alleges board didn't act as fast on safety as CEO David Calhoun said. When Boeing Co. 's board had its first formal meeting around seven weeks after the initial 737 MAX crash in late 2018, directors didn't hold in-depth discussions about the jet's safety, according to newly released details of internal company documents.

title: Dating Apps Show Surge in Americans Looking for Love Online
summary: Resume Subscription. Amid the coronavirus pandemic, more Americans are spending more time online looking for love.

title: Inside the WallStreetBets Forum That Launched GameStop Frenzy
summary: Resume Subscription. In a video posted to Reddit's WallStreetBets forum, a man hurtles down a long, steep slide, arms flailing, before slamming into the muddy ground. He then sits up, dazed.

title: Earthquake Hits Northern Japan
summary: The 7.3-magnitude quake was centered in the Pacific Ocean near Fukushima prefecture. TOKYO-An earthquake of magnitude 7.3 hit northern Japan on Saturday night, with significant shaking but no reports of major damage.

title: New York Prosecutors Investigating Trump's Manhattan Properties
summary: Officials are investigating loans the former president took on four buildings, including his flagship Trump Tower. New York prosecutors are investigating financial dealings around some of Donald Trump's signature Manhattan properties, extending the known range of the criminal probe of the former president and his company, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: U.S. Expresses Concerns Over China Withholding Data from Pandemic Investigators
summary: National security adviser says it is imperative World Health Organization report be free of China's intervention. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration issued a formal statement criticizing China over refusing to provide World Health Organization pandemic investigators with data on early Covid-19 cases that could help explain how the virus spread.

title: Health Experts Urge Caution as NYC Emerges From Latest Covid-19 Wave
summary: Gov. Andrew Cuomo recently loosened restrictions at restaurants and venues, citing falling infection rates. New York City will feel a bit more like itself soon, after state officials allowed indoor dining to resume this week and said they would permit sports and entertainment venues to operate at limited capacity later this month.

title: Trevor Bauer Became Baseball's Highest-Paid Player. The Dodgers Got a Tax Break.
summary: Bauer can earn $85 million in two years under his unusual short-term free-agent contract with the Dodgers-who can soften the penalties for their high payroll.. Trevor Bauer, by almost any objective measure, is not the best player in baseball. For the next two seasons, however, Bauer will likely be the highest-paid player in baseball.

title: Biden's Task Forces Take On Covid-19, Climate Change
summary: The 25 groups created via presidential decree are more than prior administrations had at this point. President Biden marked the early weeks of his presidency with his broad use of executive action, but he has another go-to move: the task force.

title: AI Emerges as Crucial Tool for Groups Seeking Justice for Syria War Crimes
summary: Resume Subscription. BERLIN-By most accounts, the Syrian conflict has been the most documented war in history.

title: A Domestic Terrorism Law Is Debated Anew After Capitol Siege
summary: Addressing violent extremism is a Biden priority, but whether the U.S. needs a specific new law is up for debate. As a candidate, President Biden promised to make tackling domestic violent extremism-a long-simmering issue in the U.S.-a priority.

title: Latest Remote-Learning Battle: Keep Your Cameras On
summary: Many students say they feel more engaged with their cameras on, but not if they are the only ones; parents say, just make it a rule. Rachel Anderson's fourth-grade daughter was so anxious about being on camera during remote learning that she cried every day for the first six weeks of school.

title: Purdue Lawyers Face Disclosure Questions Over Sackler Defense Deal
summary: Law firms defending Purdue Pharma in opioid probes should have disclosed a defense agreement with the company's owners, legal experts say. The law firms defending Purdue Pharma LP in probes into its OxyContin painkiller didn't disclose an existing deal with Purdue's owners to keep information shared between them confidential when the drugmaker filed for bankruptcy.

title: China's Vaccine Diplomacy Boosts Its Influence in Europe
summary: Serbia's successful use of Chinese shots inspires other European nations to seek Beijing's assistance. Some small European governments are turning to China for Covid-19 vaccines as European Union procurement stumbles and Western vaccine makers' production hiccups hamper the continent's fight against the pandemic.

title: If Tesla Bubble Bursts, Catastrophe Won't Follow
summary: Not all bubbles are equal. Britain's bicycle-stock bubble of the 1890s holds lessons for today's electric-vehicle mania.. Recent experience and financial lore have created the impression that the bursting of market bubbles brings economic destruction. But it isn't always so. The excess in today's story stocks-electric cars, clean power and cannabis in particular-surely poses a threat to the wealth of their shareholders. Even if there is a wider bubble, it might not be a catastrophe for the country.

title: Discovering Art Nouveau
summary: The early modernist style, evocative of the natural world, can be seen in abundance in whimsical buildings along the Danube and elsewhere in Europe.. There's hardly a more rewarding aspect of travel than strolling a new locale, like a modern-day flâneur. The experience is especially sweet when you see something unexpectedly stunning, as I did some years ago in Riga, Latvia. I knew about its Art Nouveau district, yet when I came upon Albert Street, lined with pastel-hued buildings festooned with faces, figures, peacocks, flowers and other Art Nouveau motifs, I was stopped in my tracks by their beauty.

title: No Hoodies and Allbirds for These Women in Tech
summary: The tech-bro uniform is on its way out. Here's how a new generation of women in tech is changing the status quo, starting with what they wear.. Off Brand is a column that delves into trends in fashion and beauty.

title: In Review, Biden Seeks New Balance in Saudi Ties
summary: Administration looks to toughen scrutiny while maintaining a key strategic relationship. As he sets about revamping policy toward Saudi Arabia, President Biden is aiming for a balance that tightens U.S. scrutiny of Riyadh, without breaking a strategic partnership that marks its 76th anniversary on Sunday, current and former U.S. officials said.

title: This Basic Strength Workout Can Help Triathlon Training or Fitness Rookies
summary: Resume Subscription. You don't need fancy gym equipment or heavy weights to build strength. Push-ups, squats and other basic body-weight exercises you probably remember from gym class can form the basis of an effective adult workout.

title: Pentagon Explores Autonomous Ships, Choppers, Jets
summary: Advanced technology developed for military uses could eventually be integrated in civilian products. From pilotless jets engaging in dogfights to huge undersea vessels ferrying troops, the Pentagon is pushing to increase the U.S. military's use of automation.

title: Challenges to Covid-19 Lockdowns Have Been Mostly Losing in Court
summary: Judges generally uphold restrictions on businesses and the scope of freedom, in biggest test of state governments' legal power in a century. When the owners of four Albuquerque trampoline parks sued New Mexico's governor for pandemic-related shutdowns that almost bankrupted them, they argued it wasn't fair that they had to close when tanning salons, guided balloon tours and ice-skating rinks stayed open.

title: Chocolat Chaud (Hot Chocolate)
summary: The secret to David Lebovitz's Parisian-style hot chocolate is whole milk and plenty of high-quality dark chocolate. To explore and search through all our recipes, check out the new WSJ Recipes page.

title: Senate Votes to Acquit Trump in Impeachment Trial
summary: Vote is 57-43 on charge that the former president incited an insurrection; seven Republicans side with Democrats in voting to convict. WASHINGTON-The Senate voted to acquit former President Donald Trump on the charge he incited an insurrection at the Capitol, capping a weeklong impeachment trial fueled by his efforts to hold on to the White House after losing the election.

title: How Roses Came to Mean True Love
summary: Our favorite Valentine's Day flower was already a symbol of passion in ancient Greek mythology. Historian Amanda Foreman searches the past for the origins of today's world. Read previous columns here.

title: What Shakespeare Can Teach Us About Empathy
summary: In an age of political division, plays like 'Othello' and 'The Merchant of Venice' offer lessons in understanding difference. The anger and unwillingness of many Americans to listen to those with different opinions is a serious societal problem. But the solution to this toxic state of things must begin on the level of the individual, with the way we listen and speak to relatives, neighbors and colleagues whose views may be diametrically opposed to our own. Lessons for modeling this kind of empathy can be found in literature-above all, in Shakespeare, whose plays are a great antidote to extremism and mean-spiritedness.

title: Facebook Meets Apple in Clash of the Tech Titans-'We Need to Inflict Pain'
summary: Resume Subscription. Facebook Inc. Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg has groused for years that Apple Inc. and its leader, Tim Cook, have too much sway over the social-media giant's business. In 2018, his anger boiled over.

title: Congress Might Soon Shake Big Tech's Foundation
summary: Lawmakers have sweeping plans to change the foundational covenant between the government and internet platforms. Some experts are cheering, others are wondering if they'll be burning down the internet rather than saving it.. Change is likely coming for Section 230, the law that protects online platforms from being held liable for things users say on them. As one of his last acts as president, Donald Trump attempted to strike down the law. President Biden has also said it should be revoked.

title: Covid-19 Testing Won't Be Required Before Domestic Flights, CDC Says
summary: Airlines had opposed such a measure; CDC reiterated guidance that Americans refrain from travel. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said Friday it won't currently recommend mandatory Covid-19 testing before domestic air travel, a proposal it had been weighing but met with strong objections from the airline industry.

title: Trump Impeachment Trial: Takeaways From the Fourth Day
summary: Key moments and themes as Trump's lawyers mounted their defense. WASHINGTON-The fourth day of the Senate impeachment trial of former President Donald Trump offered a chance for his lawyers to dispute Democrats' charge that Mr. Trump was responsible for the riot that took place on Jan. 6. Then senators were permitted to ask both sides follow-up questions. Here are eight takeaways from Friday:

title: Sen. Bill Cassidy Still Asking Questions as Impeachment Vote Nears
summary: The Louisiana Republican, a prolific note-taker during the proceedings, is a surprise swing vote. WASHINGTON-Sen. Bill Cassidy emerged this week as a wild card in the trial over whether former President Donald Trump incited the riot at the Capitol on Jan. 6, and he said Friday he still hasn't made up his mind.

title: Court Rules Smith & Wesson Can Be Liable for 2018 Shooting
summary: Company's failure to provide gun safeguards is sufficient grounds for a class-action suit to proceed, judge says. TORONTO-A Canadian court ruled Friday that victims of a 2018 shooting in Toronto have a viable legal claim of negligence against gun maker Smith & Wesson Corp. for failing provide safeguards on the gun used by the shooter.

title: Opioid Settlement Tax Breaks Sought by Drug Firms
summary: McKesson, AmerisourceBergen, Cardinal Health and Johnson & Johnson stand to reap about $1 billion each. Four pharmaceutical companies in settlement talks with states to resolve claims related to their involvement in the national opioid crisis stand to reap about $1 billion each in tax breaks if a combined payout of more than $26 billion is finalized, according to company filings.

title: CDC Presses K-12 Schools to Reopen
summary: Public-health agency issues new guidelines for schools to reopen safely. Federal health and education officials urged the nation's elementary and secondary schools on Friday to reopen safely as soon as possible, saying they can operate by strictly adhering to safety precautions to reduce the risk of Covid-19 transmission in classrooms and in their communities.

title: Private-Equity Deals for Information Technology Soar as Companies Modernize Infrastructure
summary: Investors cite increasing need for IT services in retail, healthcare, hospitality and other sectors. Private-equity investments in technology soared in the final months of 2020 as investors sought to take advantage of a rise in corporate IT spending.

title: A Refugee Bride Fights to Reach Her Groom
summary: Braving traffickers and angry seas, Sadeka found herself trapped on a remote island; 'all the women here' think about suicide. In mid-March, Sadeka Bibi set off with a small bundle of her belongings for an unmarked spot on the side of a road in southeast Bangladesh, filled at once with hope and fear.

summary: Here are seven major companies whose stocks moved on the week's news. Lyft Inc.

title: Trump Defense Team Calls Impeachment Case Absurd
summary: House Democrats have alleged former president incited riot at U.S. Capitol in early January. WASHINGTON-Donald Trump's defense team dismissed Democrats' allegations that he incited the Capitol riot as "patently absurd" and said his exhortations to supporters to fight were standard political rhetoric, in a compact rebuttal that paved the way for a Senate vote as early as Saturday on whether to convict or acquit the former president.

title: Biden's SEC Chief Nominee Reports Net Worth of Up to $119 Million
summary: Most of the former Goldman Sachs banker's earnings were from investment income. WASHINGTON-President Biden's pick to lead the Securities and Exchange Commission, Gary Gensler, has a net worth of between $41 million and $119 million, according to financial disclosures filed with the Office of Government Ethics.
